page.title: 16MILTON OF ARDLETHEN. (CONT)
page.content: Replacing roofs and insulating cattle stores are examples of recent work. The roads around the farm are either {concrete or rough track}and the woodland is of no use and will be cut down in the future. { Breeding}is left to nature but {artificial insemination}has and will be used. The diseases affecting cows are{mastitus and pneumonia}and those affecting crops are{mildew, {rynchosporium, netblotch, septoria and {blight.}Natural and chemical fertilisers are used - a mixture of {nitrogen, phosphate and potash. The market for male calves is in Turriff whereas milk is sold in Aberdeen. Potatoes are sold all over Europe. Grain is exported to Russia and Poland or sold locally.
